description: Actinic Solar Damage (Cutis Rhomboidalis Nuchae) is a skin condition caused by chronic sun exposure, leading to thickened, leathery skin on the back of the neck. It is often characterized by a diamond-shaped pattern of wrinkles and discoloration.
possible causes: Prolonged exposure to UV radiation from the sun
symptoms: Thickened, rough skin on the back of the neck
treatments: Avoiding sun exposure during peak hours
